page.title: 13HOUSES AND HOMES
page.content: MOST HOUSES BUILT IN THE LAKE DISTRICT ARE BUILT FROM LAKELAND STONE. THE STONE WAS QUARRIED FROM HARTSOP. THE NEWER HOUSES LIKE THE COUNCIL HOUSES ARE BUILT OF BRICK. MOSTLY IN PATTERDALE PEOPLE LIVE IN COTTAGES. SOME OF THE COTTAGES ROUND HERE ARE HOLIDAY COTTAGES FOR PEOPLE THAT LIVE AWAY. IN OUR AREA THERE ARE ABOUT 200 HOUSES AND HOMES . THE BIGGEST HOUSE IS PATTERDALE HALL.THERE ARE QUITE A LOT OF PUBS AND HOTELS. IN THE SUMMER THEY GET QUITE BUSY, BECAUSE OF THE TOURIST TRADE. SOME OF THE HOUSES IN OUR AREA ARE OF SPECIAL HISTORIC INTEREST AND NOW BELONG TO THE NATIONAL TRUST. IN SOME OF THE REMOTE MOUNTAIN VALLEYS SOME OF THE SHEPHERDS COTTAGES HAVE BEEN CONVERTED AS CLIMBING AND MOUNTAINEERING HUTS.
